trans-unit.source: The big idea
trans-unit.target: The big idea

trans-unit.source: Our idea is to build an information portal that helps shoppers connect with retailers through a highly-relevant, scoped-search experience, similar to how travel portals match tourists up with the hotels, restaurants, and entertainment when in uncharted territory.
trans-unit.target: Our idea is to build an information portal that helps shoppers connect with retailers through a highly-relevant, scoped-search experience, similar to how travel portals match tourists up with the hotels, restaurants, and entertainment when in uncharted territory.

trans-unit.source: The portal we envision will deliver an exceptionally high-quality search experience over retailer data in a given market, helping shoppers find stores based on location and other amenities the retailer provides.
trans-unit.target: The portal we envision will deliver an exceptionally high-quality search experience over retailer data in a given market, helping shoppers find stores based on location and other amenities the retailer provides.

trans-unit.source: We will seed the search engine with an initial dataset, but deeper value will be built over time, with the help of retailer subscribers who post information about their business.
trans-unit.target: We will seed the search engine with an initial dataset, but deeper value will be built over time, with the help of retailer subscribers who post information about their business.

trans-unit.source: Promotions, new merchandise, popular brands, in-house specialty services -– all are examples of data that adds value to our site.
trans-unit.target: Promotions, new merchandise, popular brands, in-house specialty services -– all are examples of data that adds value to our site.

trans-unit.source: This data is self-reported and integrated into the search corpus, once the retailer signs up as a subscriber.
trans-unit.target: This data is self-reported and integrated into the search corpus, once the retailer signs up as a subscriber.

trans-unit.source: Advertising, plus the subscription model, provide the revenue stream for our new business.
trans-unit.target: Advertising, plus the subscription model, provide the revenue stream for our new business.

trans-unit.source: Search will be the predominant user interaction model, on a pure cloud platform.
trans-unit.target: Search will be the predominant user interaction model, on a pure cloud platform.

trans-unit.source: For purposes of scale and low-costs, almost everything we do, from the portal experience to source control, will be through an online service.
trans-unit.target: For purposes of scale and low-costs, almost everything we do, from the portal experience to source control, will be through an online service.

trans-unit.source: Using a search engine that provides the features we need out of the box, we can create a search application quickly, without having to build and manage a search engine ourselves.
trans-unit.target: Using a search engine that provides the features we need out of the box, we can create a search application quickly, without having to build and manage a search engine ourselves.

trans-unit.target: Authentication, permissions and sensitive data

trans-unit.source: Shoppers browse the site anonymously.
trans-unit.target: Shoppers browse the site anonymously.

trans-unit.target: Retailers are a different story.

trans-unit.target: Here, we store public-facing profile information, billing information, and media content that they want to expose on the site.

trans-unit.source: We opted for an authentication model based on .NET forms-based authentication.

trans-unit.source: We chose this approach for its simplicity; we didn’t need the roles, UI support and other extraneous features that come with other approaches.
trans-unit.target: We chose this approach for its simplicity; we didn’t need the roles, UI support and other extraneous features that come with other approaches.

trans-unit.source: To ensure that retailers only see the data that belongs to them, we created a retailer ID for each retailer that is subsequently used on all read and write operations involving retailer-specific data.
trans-unit.target: To ensure that retailers only see the data that belongs to them, we created a retailer ID for each retailer that is subsequently used on all read and write operations involving retailer-specific data.

trans-unit.target: With this approach, we found that we did not need to grant database permissions to individual retailers.

trans-unit.source: All retailers interact with the system under a single database role, with the retailer ID as our data isolation technique.
trans-unit.target: All retailers interact with the system under a single database role, with the retailer ID as our data isolation technique.

trans-unit.source: Because our business is all about the downstream effects (driving more business to retailers, creating incentive to advertise and subscribe), we can draw the line at handling purchases over the web.

trans-unit.source: The only code change we made was to accommodate the indexer job was to add an `Indexed` field to our data model to indicate the index state.
trans-unit.target: The only code change we made was to accommodate the indexer job was to add an `Indexed` field to our data model to indicate the index state.

trans-unit.source: Whenever a new profile is added or updated, the `Indexed` field is set to false.
trans-unit.target: Whenever a new profile is added or updated, the `Indexed` field is set to false.

trans-unit.source: The job looks for all rows having `Indexed` set to false.
trans-unit.target: The job looks for all rows having `Indexed` set to false.

trans-unit.source: When it finds the row, the document is posted to Azure Search, and then the `Indexed` field is set to true.
trans-unit.target: When it finds the row, the document is posted to Azure Search, and then the `Indexed` field is set to true.

trans-unit.source: Backup strategy
trans-unit.target: Backup strategy

trans-unit.source: We designed a multi-tiered backup strategy to recover from a range of scenarios, from catastrophic failure, down to recovery of an individual transaction.
trans-unit.target: We designed a multi-tiered backup strategy to recover from a range of scenarios, from catastrophic failure, down to recovery of an individual transaction.

trans-unit.source: The assets to protect include three kinds of data (web site, subscriber data, and media files).
trans-unit.target: The assets to protect include three kinds of data (web site, subscriber data, and media files).

trans-unit.source: First, by keeping the web site source code in TFS Online, we know that if the site goes down, we can rebuild it by republishing from TFS.
trans-unit.target: First, by keeping the web site source code in TFS Online, we know that if the site goes down, we can rebuild it by republishing from TFS.

trans-unit.source: Subscriber data in Azure SQL Database is the most sensitive asset.
trans-unit.target: Subscriber data in Azure SQL Database is the most sensitive asset.

trans-unit.source: We back this up using the built-in feature (see [Azure SQL Database Backup and Restore](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/jj650016.aspx)).
trans-unit.target: We back this up using the built-in feature (see [Azure SQL Database Backup and Restore](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/jj650016.aspx)).

trans-unit.source: The backup schedule is full database backup once a week, differential database backups once a day, and transaction log backups every 5 minutes.
trans-unit.target: The backup schedule is full database backup once a week, differential database backups once a day, and transaction log backups every 5 minutes.

trans-unit.source: Given the size of the data, this solution is more than adequate for our immediate and projected data volumes.
trans-unit.target: Given the size of the data, this solution is more than adequate for our immediate and projected data volumes.

trans-unit.source: Third, we store image and video files in Azure BLOB storage.
trans-unit.target: Third, we store image and video files in Azure BLOB storage.

trans-unit.source: What we learned
trans-unit.target: What we learned

trans-unit.source: Because we already had data, it was easy to establish proof-of-concept.
trans-unit.target: Because we already had data, it was easy to establish proof-of-concept.

trans-unit.source: Within hours, we had a prototype with facets and counters, paging, ranked profiles, and search results.
trans-unit.target: Within hours, we had a prototype with facets and counters, paging, ranked profiles, and search results.

trans-unit.source: The search results were so precise, we decided to remove some of the filters presented to the end customer.
trans-unit.target: The search results were so precise, we decided to remove some of the filters presented to the end customer.

trans-unit.source: The biggest surprise for us was how fast we could learn Azure Search, and how much we got back.
trans-unit.target: The biggest surprise for us was how fast we could learn Azure Search, and how much we got back.

trans-unit.source: Literally, we established proof-of-concept in a few hours (see the note below), replacing 500 lines of code with 3 lines of code in the front end application (plus a new WebJob), and getting better results.
trans-unit.target: Literally, we established proof-of-concept in a few hours (see the note below), replacing 500 lines of code with 3 lines of code in the front end application (plus a new WebJob), and getting better results.

trans-unit.source: Previously, our code implemented paging, counts, and other behaviors that are standard to search.
trans-unit.target: Previously, our code implemented paging, counts, and other behaviors that are standard to search.

trans-unit.source: Using Azure Search, the results we get back include the search hits, facets, paging data, counts -- all the stuff we needed and were having to supply ourselves.
trans-unit.target: Using Azure Search, the results we get back include the search hits, facets, paging data, counts -- all the stuff we needed and were having to supply ourselves.

trans-unit.source: It also included boosting and built-in faceted navigation, which we didn’t have in our original solution.
trans-unit.target: It also included boosting and built-in faceted navigation, which we didn’t have in our original solution.

trans-unit.source: The greatest challenge during implementation was that it was a Preview version and finding information and shared experiences was difficult.
trans-unit.target: The greatest challenge during implementation was that it was a Preview version and finding information and shared experiences was difficult.

trans-unit.source: Once we connected a few dots, we found that using Azure Search Service was pretty simple due to its REST API and JSON data format.
trans-unit.target: Once we connected a few dots, we found that using Azure Search Service was pretty simple due to its REST API and JSON data format.

trans-unit.source: We could call the framework directly from most open source plugins like JQuery JSON.Net, and we could use tools like Fiddler for fast experimentation and debugging.
trans-unit.target: We could call the framework directly from most open source plugins like JQuery JSON.Net, and we could use tools like Fiddler for fast experimentation and debugging.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] Besides having the data prepped, it helped that those of us building the prototype already understood how search technology works, making us more productive, and more appreciative of the built-in features.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] Besides having the data prepped, it helped that those of us building the prototype already understood how search technology works, making us more productive, and more appreciative of the built-in features.

trans-unit.source: If you need to ramp up on search query construction, faceted navigation, filters, etc. you should expect prototyping to take longer.
trans-unit.target: If you need to ramp up on search query construction, faceted navigation, filters, etc. you should expect prototyping to take longer.

trans-unit.source: Controlling facets in the search presentation page
trans-unit.target: Controlling facets in the search presentation page

trans-unit.source: One of our learnings during the proof-of-concept was to plan facets carefully upfront.
trans-unit.target: One of our learnings during the proof-of-concept was to plan facets carefully upfront.

trans-unit.source: After loading a lot of data into the solution, we saw that the sheer volume of facets was too high to present to the users.
trans-unit.target: After loading a lot of data into the solution, we saw that the sheer volume of facets was too high to present to the users.

trans-unit.source: We solved this by constraining the facet count parameter.
trans-unit.target: We solved this by constraining the facet count parameter.

trans-unit.source: The count parameter imposes a hard limit on the number of facets returned to the user.
trans-unit.target: The count parameter imposes a hard limit on the number of facets returned to the user.

trans-unit.source: A link that includes a discussion of the count parameter can be found [here](search-faceted-navigation.md).
trans-unit.target: A link that includes a discussion of the count parameter can be found [here](search-faceted-navigation.md).

trans-unit.source: WebJobs for scheduling tasks
trans-unit.target: WebJobs for scheduling tasks

trans-unit.source: Azure Search wasn’t the only pleasant surprise for us.
trans-unit.target: Azure Search wasn’t the only pleasant surprise for us.

trans-unit.source: We discovered that using WebJobs to automate our data load operations to Azure Search was vastly superior to our previous approach, which entailed using a dedicated VM running Windows Scheduler, with scheduled tasks for updating the search index.
trans-unit.target: We discovered that using WebJobs to automate our data load operations to Azure Search was vastly superior to our previous approach, which entailed using a dedicated VM running Windows Scheduler, with scheduled tasks for updating the search index.

trans-unit.source: WebJobs was simpler to configure and easier to debug, and of course much cheaper than having to pay for a dedicated VM.
trans-unit.target: WebJobs was simpler to configure and easier to debug, and of course much cheaper than having to pay for a dedicated VM.

trans-unit.target: Azure BLOB Storage Explorer for updating images

trans-unit.target: We found that using [Azure BLOB Storage Explorer](https://azurestorageexplorer.codeplex.com/) (available on codeplex) to be very helpful in managing image and video updates to the site.
